text: Agujaceratops (meaning "horned face from Aguja") is a chasmosaurine ceratopsid known from two species, A. mariscalensis (Lehman, 1989) and A. mavericus (Lehman et al., 2016), both discovered in Aguja, Texas. ==History of discovery== ===Agujaceratops mariscalensis=== The type species, A. mariscalensis, was first discovered in 1938, when three bonebeds was discovered and excavated by William Strain. The material was described, studied and named in 1989. ===Agujaceratops mavericus=== A. mavericus was described, studied and named in 2016. Category:Ceratopsia Category:Cretaceous dinosaurs
title: Agujaceratops
